children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var detectedResponse = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getDetectedLanguage('Please detect the language of this text', {"translator":'IBM'}); gs.info(JSON.stringify(detectedResponse));
children.text2:
This  shows code in a server-side script that detects a string in English using
        IBM's translation service.

children.name: alternatives
text
children.text: String
children.text2: Text to use to detect the language.

children.name: Output
children.text: {"code":"40003","message":"Translator (\"translator\" field) is invalid"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var detectedResponse = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getDetectedLanguage('Please detect the language of this text', {"translator":123}); gs.info(JSON.stringify(detectedResponse));
children.text2:
This  shows a server script that throws an error when an invalid translation service
        is passed in.

children.name: parms
children.text: Object
children.text2: Optional. JSON object that contains additional translation parameters.

children.name: alternatives.code
children.text:
Language code of the alternative language.

Data type: String

children.name: alternatives.confidence
children.text:
Float value indicating the confidence level of the alternative language. Value is between zero and one. The lower the value, the lower the confidence level.

Data type: String

children.name: parms.translator
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Translation service to use to translate the text (not case-sensitive).

Valid values:

  • Google
  • Microsoft
  • IBM
  • <custom>
Note: To use custom translation services you must first configure the translation service in your instance. For details, see Integrate with a translation service provider.

Default: Translation service configured in the Translator Configuration [sn_dt_translator_configuration] table.

children.name: alternatives.name
children.text:
Language code of the alternative language.

Data type: String

children.name: detectedLanguage
children.text:
Description of the detected language.

Data type: Object

"detectedLanguage": {
  "code": "String",
  "confidence": "String",
  "name": "String"
}

children.name: detectedLanguage.code
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: detectedLanguage.confidence
children.text:
Float value indicating the confidence level of the alternative language. Value is between zero and one. The lower the value, the lower the confidence level.

Data type: String

children.name: detectedLanguage.name
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: translator
children.text:
Translation service used to detect the language.

Data type: String

children.name: Error messages
children.text:
The following are error messages that the method may return and indications as to the error's root cause.
  • Text ("text" field) is missing or invalid. (40000): The text to translate is either missing or not a string.
  • Dynamic Translation plugin is not installed. (40001): The Dynamic Translation API was invoked without activating the com.glide.dynamic_translation plugin. For information on activating this plugin, see Dynamic translation overview.
  • Translator ("translator" field) is invalid. (40003): The passed in translator parameter is not a string.
  • <translator> translator is not configured. (40004): The specified translation service is not configured in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • <translator> translator is inactive. (40005): The specified translation service is not set to Active in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Additional parameters are invalid. (40006): The additional parameters that were passed are not an object.
  • Maximum time limit has been exceeded. (40009): The operation took longer than the defined timeout value specified in the Translation Configuration. Default: 40 seconds
  • Default translator is not configured for detection. (40011): The default translation service has not been specified for language detection in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • <translator> translator is not configured for detection. (40013): The specified translation service is not configured for language detection in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Unknown error occurred. (40051): Default error thrown when the error doesn’t fall in to any other category.
  • Text ("text" field) has exceeded its maximum length. (40052): The text that was passed in to translate exceeds the maximum length supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Request is not authorized because credentials are missing or invalid (40055): The credentials configured for the translation service in Connections & Credentials are not valid. For information on connections and credentials, see Dynamic translation overview.

children.name: getDetectedLanguage(String text, Object parms)
children.text: Detects the language of the passed in text.
children.text2:
If you pass in a translator, the method uses that translation service to detect the source language. Otherwise, the detection is performed by the default translation service. Ensure that the text strings that you provide contain enough verbiage to enable proper language detection.

In addition to the detected language, the response contains a confidence level of the detection, along with other possible language alternatives. If a translator is not passed in, the method also returns the default translation service used to detect the language.

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var detectedResponse = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getDetectedLanguages(["First text string language to detect", "Second text string language to detect"], {"translator": "Microsoft"}); gs.info(JSON.stringify(detectedResponse));
children.text2:
This  shows code in a server script that detects English as the language of the
        passed-in strings using the Microsoft translation service.

children.name: texts
children.text: Array
children.text2:
List of text strings to use to detect the
              language(s).

children.name: detections
children.text:
Language detection of text strings.

Data type: Object

"detections": {
  "alternatives": [Array],
  "detectedLanguage": {Object},
  "isError": Boolean
]

children.name: detections.alternatives
parms
children.text: Object

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: var detectedResponse = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getDetectedLanguages(["First text string language to detect", ""], {"translator": "Microsoft"}); gs.info(JSON.stringify(detectedResponse));
children.text2:
This  shows code in a server script that returns a Partial status when two text
        strings are passed in and one of them is invalid.

children.name: Output
children.text: {"code":"40003","message":"Translator (\"translator\" field) is invalid","status":"Error"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var detectedResponse = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getDetectedLanguages(["First text string language to detect", "Second text string language to detect"], {"translator": "123"}); gs.info(JSON.stringify(detectedResponse));
children.text2:
This  shows code in a server script that throws an error when an invalid translation
        service is passed in.

children.name: parms.translator
children.text: String
children.text2:
Translation service to use to detect the language of a string. Translation services are configured under the Translator Configuration menu and located in the Translator Configuration [sn_dt_translator_configuration] table.

Possible values - not case-sensitive:

  • Google
  • Microsoft
  • IBM
  • <custom>
Note: To use custom translation services you must first configure the translation service in your instance. For details, see Integrate with a translation service provider.

Default: Translation service configured in the Translator Configuration [sn_dt_translator_configuration] table.

children.name: detections.alternatives.code
children.text:
Language code of the alternative language.

Data type: String

children.name: detections.alternatives.confidence
children.text:
Float value indicating the confidence level of the alternative language. Value is between zero and one. The lower the value, the lower the confidence level.

Data type: String

children.name: detections.alternatives.name
children.text:
Language code of the alternative language.

Data type: String

children.name: detections.detectedLanguage
children.text:
Description of the detected language.

Data type: Object

"detectedLanguage": {
  "code": "String",
  "confidence": "String",
  "name": "String"
}

children.name: detections.detectedLanguage.code
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: detections.detectedLanguage.confidence
children.text:
Float value indicating the confidence level of the alternative language. Value is between zero and one. The lower the value, the lower the confidence level.

Data type: String

children.name: detections.detectedLanguage.name
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: detections.isError
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the detection of language for the text resulted in an error.
Valid values:
  • true: Error encountered.
  • false: Language detection was successful.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: status
children.text:
Status of the response to the method call.
Possible values:
  • Error
  • Partial
  • Success

Data type: String

children.name: translator
children.text:
Translation service used to detect the language.

Data type: String

children.name: Error messages
children.text:
The following are error messages that the method may return and indications as to the error's root cause.
  • Text ("text" field) is missing or invalid. (40000): The text to translate is either missing or not a string.
  • Dynamic Translation plugin is not installed. (40001): The Dynamic Translation API was invoked without activating the com.glide.dynamic_translation plugin. For information on activating this plugin, see Dynamic translation overview.
  • Translator ("translator" field) is invalid. (40003): The passed in translator parameter is not a string.
  • <translator> translator is not configured. (40004): The specified translation service is not configured in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • <translator> translator is inactive. (40005): The specified translation service is not set to Active in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Additional parameters are invalid. (40006): The additional parameters that were passed are not an object.
  • Maximum time limit has been exceeded. (40009): The operation took longer than the defined timeout value specified in the Translation Configuration. Default: 40 seconds
  • Request failed with multiple errors. (40010): Multiple errors occurred in the language detection call. For more information, refer to the response for each individual text string.
  • Default translator is not configured for detection. (40011): The default translation service has not been specified for language detection in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • <translator> translator is not configured for detection. (40013): The specified translation service is not configured for language detection in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Translator configuration version is invalid. Migrate to v3. (40014): The associated version of the Translator Configuration for the specified translation service does not support the specified text translation method. For more information, see Migrate to version v3 of a translator configuration.
  • Unknown error occurred. (40051): Default error thrown when the error doesn’t fall in to any other category.
  • Text ("text" field) has exceeded its maximum length. (40052): The text that was passed in to translate exceeds the maximum length supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Request is not authorized because credentials are missing or invalid (40055): The credentials configured for the translation service in Connections & Credentials are not valid. For information on connections and credentials, see Dynamic translation overview.

children.name: getDetectedLanguages(Array texts, Object parms)
children.text: Detects the languages of the passed in text strings.
children.text2:
If you pass in a translator, the method uses that translation service to detect the source language. Otherwise, the detection is performed by the default translation service. Ensure that the text strings that you provide contain enough verbiage to enable proper language detection.

In addition to the detected language, the response contains a confidence level of the detection, along with other possible language alternatives. If a translator is not passed in, the method also returns the default translation service used to detect the language.

children.name: textToTranslate
children.text: String
children.text2: Text to translate.

children.name: detectedLanguage
Output
Example
children.text: try { gs.info(JSON.stringify(sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getTranslation("Translate this text using platform from server", { "targetLanguages": ["fr", "it"], "additionalParameters": [{ "parameterName": "texttype", "parameterValue": "plain" }], "translator": "Microsoft" }))); } catch (error) { gs.info(error.message); }
children.text2:
This  shows a server script translating plain text from English (detected) into
        French and Italian using Microsoft's translation service.

children.name: detectedLanguage.code
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: Output
children.text: {"code":"40054","message":"Target language is invalid"}

children.name: Example
children.text: try { gs.info(JSON.stringify(sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getTranslation("Translate this text using platform from server", { "targetLanguages": ["123"], "additionalParameters": [{ "parameterName": "texttype", "parameterValue": "plain" }], "translator": "Microsoft" }))); } catch (error) { gs.info(error.message); }
children.text2:
This  shows a server script that throws an error when an invalid target language is
        passed in.

children.name: parms
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional. JSON object that contains additional translation parameters.
"parms": {
  "additionalParameters": {Object},
  "sourceLanguage": "String",
  "targetLanguages": [Array],
  "translator": "String"
}

children.name: parms.additionalParameters
children.text: Array

children.name: detectedLanguage.name
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: translations
parms.additionalParameters.parameterName
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Key name.

Valid values:

  • textype: Type of text to translate. For Microsoft Azure Translator Service only.

children.name: translations.targetLanguage
children.text:
Language code to which the source text was translated.

Data type: String

children.name: parms.additionalParameters.parameterValue
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Value of the associated key.

Valid values:

  • plain: Standard text string
  • html: HTML text string

Default: plain

children.name: parms.sourceLanguage
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Language code of the source text.

Default: Translation service detects the source language.

children.name: translations.translatedText
children.text:
Translated text.

Data type: String

children.name: parms.targetLanguages
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Optional. List of language codes to use to translate the text. The method returns translated text for each language code.

Default: User preferred language.

children.name: translator
children.text:
Translation service used to detect the language.

Data type: String

children.name: parms.translator
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Translation service to use to translate the text (not case-sensitive).

Valid values:

  • Google
  • Microsoft
  • IBM
  • <custom>
Note: To use custom translation services you must first configure the translation service in your instance. For details, see Integrate with a translation service provider.

Default: Translation service configured in the Translator Configuration [sn_dt_translator_configuration] table.

children.name: Error messages
children.text:
The following are error messages that the method may return and indications as to their root cause.
  • Text ("text" field) is missing or invalid. (40000): The text to translate is either missing or not a string.
  • Dynamic Translation plugin is not installed. (40001): The Dynamic Translation API was invoked without activating the com.glide.dynamic_translation plugin. For information on activating this plugin, see Dynamic translation overview.
  • Default translator is not configured for translation. (40002): No translation service is selected as the default translation service in the Translator Configurations. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Translator ("translator" field) is invalid. (40003): The passed in translator parameter is not a string.
  • <translator> translator is not configured. (40004): The specified translation service is not configured in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • <translator> translator is inactive. (40005): The specified translation service is not set to Active in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Additional parameters are invalid. (40006): The additional parameters that were passed are not an object.
  • Target languages ("targetLanguages" field) are invalid. (40007): The targetLanguages parameter is passed in the call but is not valid for one of the following reasons:
    • Value is not an array
    • Array is empty
    • One or multiple of the entries is not a string
  • Source language ("sourceLanguage" field) is invalid. (40008): The sourceLanguage parameter is passed in the call but the value is not a String.
  • Maximum time limit has been exceeded. (40009): The operation took longer than the defined timeout value specified in the Translation Configuration. Default: 40 seconds
  • <translator> translator is not configured for translation. (40012): The specified translation service is not configured for text translation in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Unknown error occurred. (40051): Default error thrown when the error doesn’t fall in to any other category.
  • Text ("text" field) has exceeded its maximum length. (40052): The text that was passed in to translate exceeds the maximum length supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Source language is invalid. (40053): The passed in sourceLanguage parameter contains a language code that is not supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Target language is invalid. (40054): One or more of the language codes passed in the targetLanguages parameter is not supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Request is not authorized because credentials are missing or invalid (40055): The credentials configured for the translation service in Connections & Credentials are not valid. For information on connections and credentials, see Dynamic translation overview.
  • Text cannot be translated to target languages. (40056): The specified translation service is not able to translate the passed in text into the specified target languages.

children.name: getTranslation(String textToTranslate, Object parms)
children.text: Translates the passed in text to one or more languages.
children.text2: The method uses translation services, such as Microsoft Azure Translator Service, IBM Watson Translator Service, and Google Cloud Translator Service, to perform the translation. If you do not pass in translation parameters, the method uses the system default.

children.name: texts
children.text: Array
children.text2: List of text stings to translate.

children.name: status
children.text:
Status of the response to the method call.
Possible values:
  • Error
  • Partial
  • Success

Data type: String

children.name: Output
Example
children.text: try { gs.info(JSON.stringify(sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getTranslations(["Translate first text using platform from server", "Translate second text using platform from server"], { "targetLanguages": ["fr", "it"], "additionalParameters": [{"parameterName": "texttype", "parameterValue": "plain"}], "translator": "Microsoft" }))); } catch (error) { gs.error(error.message); }
children.text2:
This  shows code in a server-side script that translates a list of text strings into
        French and Italian using the Microsoft translation service.

children.name: translations
Output
Example
children.text: try { gs.info(JSON.stringify(sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getTranslations(["Translate first text using platform from server", ""], { "targetLanguages": ["fr", "it"], "additionalParameters": [{"parameterName": "texttype", "parameterValue": "plain"}], "translator": "Microsoft" }))); } catch (error) { gs.error(error.message); }
children.text2:
This  shows a server script that returns a Partial status when one of the two passed
        in text strings is invalid.

children.name: parms
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional. JSON object that contains additional translation parameters.
"parms": {
  "additionalParameters": {Object},
  "sourceLanguage": "String",
  "targetLanguages": [Array],
  "translator": "String"
}

children.name: parms.additionalParameters
children.text: Object

children.name: translations.isError
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the translation of the text resulted in an error.
Valid values:
  • true: Error encountered.
  • false: Text translation was successful.

Data type: Boolean

children.name: Output
children.text: {"code":"40003","message":"Translator (\"translator\" field) is invalid","status":"Error"}

children.name: Example
children.text: try { gs.info(JSON.stringify(sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.getTranslations(["Translate first text using platform from server", "Translate second text using platform from server"], { "targetLanguages": ["fr", "it"], "additionalParameters": [{"parameterName": "texttype", "parameterValue": "plain"}], "translator": 123 }))); } catch (error) { gs.error(error.message); }
children.text2:
This  shows a server script that throws an error when an invalid translation service
        is passed in.

children.name: parms.additionalParameters.parameterName
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Key name.

Valid values:

  • textype: Type of text to translate. For Microsoft Azure Translator Service only.

children.name: translations.detectedLanguage
children.text:
Description of the detected language.

Data type: Object

"detectedLanguage": {
  "code": "String",
  "name": "String"
}

children.name: parms.additionalParameters.parameterValue
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Value of the associated key.

Valid values:

  • plain: Standard text string
  • html: HTML text string

Default: plain

children.name: translations.detectedLanguage.code
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: translations.detectedLanguage.name
children.text:
Language code of the detected language.

Data type: String

children.name: parms.sourceLanguage
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Language code of the source text.

Default: Translation service detects the source language.

children.name: parms.targetLanguages
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Optional. List of language codes to use to translate the text. The method returns translated text for each language code.

Default: User preferred language.

children.name: textTranlations
parms.translator
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Translation service to use to translate the text (not case-sensitive).

Valid values:

  • Google

  • <custom>
Note: To use custom translation services you must first configure the translation service in your instance. For details, see Integrate with a translation service provider.

Default: Translation service configured in the Translator Configuration [sn_dt_translator_configuration] table.

Translation service used to translate the text.

children.name: Error messages
children.text:
The following are error messages that the method may return and indications as to their root cause.
  • Text ("text" field) is missing or invalid. (40000): The text to translate is either missing or not a string.
  • Dynamic Translation plugin is not installed. (40001): The Dynamic Translation API was invoked without activating the com.glide.dynamic_translation plugin. For information on activating this plugin, see Dynamic translation overview.
  • Default translator is not configured for translation. (40002): No translation service is selected as the default translation service in the Translator Configurations. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Translator ("translator" field) is invalid. (40003): The passed in translator parameter is not a string.
  • <translator> translator is not configured. (40004): The specified translation service is not configured in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • <translator> translator is inactive. (40005): The specified translation service is not set to Active in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Additional parameters are invalid. (40006): The additional parameters that were passed are not an object.
  • Target languages ("targetLanguages" field) are invalid. (40007): The targetLanguages parameter is passed in the call but is not valid for one of the following reasons:
    • Value is not an array
    • Array is empty
    • One or multiple of the entries is not a string
  • Source language ("sourceLanguage" field) is invalid. (40008): The sourceLanguage parameter is passed in the call but the value is not a String.
  • Maximum time limit has been exceeded. (40009): The operation took longer than the defined timeout value specified in the Translation Configuration. Default: 40 seconds
  • Request failed with multiple errors. (40010): Multiple errors occurred in the language detection call. For more information, refer to the response for each individual text string.
  • <translator> translator is not configured for translation. (40012): The specified translation service is not configured for text translation in the Translator Configuration. For information on creating/modifying a translator configuration, see Create a translator configuration.
  • Translator configuration version is invalid. Migrate to v3. (40014): The associated version of the Translator Configuration for the specified translation service does not support the specified text translation method. For more information, see Migrate to version v3 of a translator configuration.
  • Unknown error occurred. (40051): Default error thrown when the error doesn’t fall in to any other category.
  • Text ("text" field) has exceeded its maximum length. (40052): The text that was passed in to translate exceeds the maximum length supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Source language is invalid. (40053): The passed in sourceLanguage parameter contains a language code that is not supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Target language is invalid. (40054): One or more of the language codes passed in the targetLanguages parameter is not supported by the corresponding translation service.
  • Request is not authorized because credentials are missing or invalid (40055): The credentials configured for the translation service in Connections & Credentials are not valid. For information on connections and credentials, see Dynamic translation overview.
  • Text cannot be translated to target languages. (40056): The specified translation service is not able to translate the passed in text into the specified target languages.

children.name: getTranslations(Array texts, Object parms)
children.text: Translates the passed in text strings to one or more languages.
children.text2: The method uses translation services, such as Microsoft Azure Translator Service, IBM Watson Translator Service, and Google Cloud Translator Service, to perform the translation. If you do not pass in translation parameters, the method uses the system default.

children.name: batchDetection
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the getDetectedLanguages() method is enabled.
Possible values:
  • true: Enabled
  • false: Disabled

Data type: Boolean

children.name: translator
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Translation service to use to verify whether the methods are active. Translation services are configured under the Translator Configuration menu.

Possible values - not case-sensitive:

  • Google
  • Microsoft
  • IBM
  • <custom>
Note: To use custom translation services you must first configure the translation service in your instance. For details, see Integrate with a translation service provider.

Default: Default translation service.

children.name: Output
children.text: {"detection":true,"batchTranslation":true,"batchDetection":true,"translation":true}

children.name: Example
children.text: try { var response = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.isEnabled('Microsoft'); gs.info(JSON.stringify(response)); } catch(error) { gs.info(error.message); }
children.text2: This shows a server script that checks whether the DynamicTranslation methods are active for the Microsoft translator.

children.name: batchTranslation
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the getTranslations() method is enabled.
Possible values:
  • true: Enabled
  • false: Disabled

Data type: Boolean

children.name: Output
children.text: {"code":"40003","message":"Translator (\"translator\" field) is invalid"}

children.name: Example
children.text: try { var response = sn_dt_api.DynamicTranslation.isEnabled(123); gs.info(JSON.stringify(response)); } catch(error) { gs.info(error.message); }
children.text2:
This  shows a server script that throws an error when an invalid translation service
        is passed in.

children.name: detection
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the getDetectedLanguage() method is enabled.
Possible values:
  • true: Enabled
  • false: Disabled

Data type: Boolean

children.name: translation
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the getTranslation() method is enabled.
Possible values:
  • true: Enabled
  • false: Disabled

Data type: Boolean

children.name: Error messages
children.text:
The following are error messages that the API may return and indications as to their root cause.
  • Translator ("translator" field) is invalid. (40003): The passed in translator parameter is not a string.

children.name: isEnabled(String translator)
children.text: Determines whether the various methods in the DynamicTranslation API are enabled for a translation service.
children.text2: If you pass in a specific translation service, the method checks the method activation for that translation service; otherwise the method checks the default translation service.

name: DynamicTranslation
text: The DynamicTranslation API provides methods that translate text, in real time, into multiple languages using translation service providers.
text2:
In addition, you can use this API to detect the language of a specific string and check whether the DynamicTranslation methods are enabled for a translation service. Use this API to create a seamless localization experience for your user interface, enabling one interface to service multiple countries.

Currently this API supports three translation service providers: Microsoft Azure Translator Service, IBM Watson Translator Service, and Google Cloud Translator Service. You can also configure other translation services within your instance and then use the DynamicTranslation API to translate your text.

When using these methods in a server-side script, use the sn_dt_api namespace identifier. Before you are able to use this API, you must activate the DynamicTranslation (com.glide.dynamic_translation) plugin. For information on this plugin and additional information on Dynamic Translation, refer to Dynamic translation overview.
